questions.text: Match the following as per the correct options in column A and B:
Match the following cancers with the respective genes involved:
Which of the following is true about the glomerular disease depicted in the image?

options.label: A
options.text: Immune complex mediated crescentic glomerulonephritis (type 2) is associated with linear staining of IgG along glomerular basement membrane

options.label: B
options.text: Anti-GBM disease (type 1) is associated with granular staining of IgG along glomerular basement membrane

options.label: C
options.text: In pauci-immune complex crescentic GN (type 3), electron dense deposits are commonly present

options.label: D
options.text: Pauci-immune complex crescentic GN (type 3) is the most common subtype of crescentic glomerulonephritis

questions.correct_answer: D. Pauci-immune complex crescentic GN (type 3) is the most common subtype of crescentic glomerulonephritis
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Pauci-immune complex crescentic GN (type 3) is the most common subtype of crescentic glomerulonephritis

questions.text: Arrange the blood products in their ascending order of shelf life in the blood bank:

options.label: A
options.text: Platelets (with agitation)--- saline washed red cells ----Cryoprecipitate---- irradiated red cells

options.label: B
options.text: Saline washed red cells ---- platelets (with agitation)--- Cryoprecipitate----irradiated red cells

options.label: C
options.text: Saline washed red cells ---- platelets (with agitation) ---irradiated red cells --- Cryoprecipitate

options.label: D
options.text: Platelets (with agitation)--- saline washed red cells ---- irradiated red cells ----Cryoprecipitate

questions.correct_answer: C. Saline washed red cells ---- platelets (with agitation) ---irradiated red cells --- Cryoprecipitate
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Saline washed red cells ---- platelets (with agitation) ---irradiated red cells --- Cryoprecipitate

questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents with painless lymphadenopathy, night sweats, and weight loss. A lymph node biopsy is done following which a diagnosis of nodular sclerosis Hodgkin lymphoma is made. Which of the following statements about this condition is false? EBV Negative Mediastinum is rarely affected Collagen bands are present in cellular areas Poor prognosis compared to classical HL
A 62-year-old man presents with hematuria and a mass in the kidney. Histopathology reveals cells with clear cytoplasm. Which genetic mutation is most likely associated with this tumor?

A 65-year-old male presents with fatigue, pallor, and shortness of breath on exertion. Laboratory results show hemoglobin of 8.5 g/dL, mean corpuscular volume (MCV) of 115 fL, and a peripheral blood smear revealing hypersegmented neutrophils and macro-ovalocytes. Further testing shows elevated methylmalonic acid (MMA) and homocysteine levels. Anti-intrinsic factor antibodies are negative. What is the most likely cause of his anemia?

options.label: B
options.text: Vitamin B12 deficiency due to dietary insufficiency

questions.correct_answer: B. Vitamin B12 deficiency due to dietary insufficiency
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Vitamin B12 deficiency due to dietary insufficiency

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about the coagulation cascade?

options.label: A
options.text: Vitamin K dependent factors are 2,7,9 and 10

options.label: B
options.text: Factors XI and XIII are increased during pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Deficiency of factor XII does not lead to bleeding

options.label: D
options.text: The deficiency of factor XIII presents as prolonged bleeding from umbilical cord

questions.correct_answer: B. Factors XI and XIII are increased during pregnancy
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Factors XI and XIII are increased during pregnancy

questions.text: A young female presents with recurrent abdominal pain and melena. Physical examination reveals multiple pigmented macules on her lips, buccal mucosa, and fingers. Her family history is significant for multiple relatives with gastrointestinal cancers. Which of the following is true for her? Mean age of presentation is 10-15 years Reduced risk of intussusceptions Absence of the STK11 mutations does not exclude the diagnosis Histology of the polyp shows arborization and presence of smooth muscle intermixed with lamina propria

A 15-year-old tall and slender male with long limbs presents with multiple painless mucosal nodules on the lips and tongue. His father died because of some cancer in the neck. Physical examination reveals a ganglioneuroma on the posterior tongue. Genetic testing confirms a mutation in the RET proto-oncogene. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not correctly matched?

options.label: A
options.text: HBV: DNA virus causing hepatocellular cancer

options.label: C
options.text: Clonorchis sinensis: cancer of gall bladder

questions.correct_answer: C. Clonorchis sinensis: cancer of gall bladder
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Clonorchis sinensis: cancer of gall bladder

questions.text: A 55-year-old male with an undiagnosed malignancy presents to the emergency department with diffuse petechiae, purpura, and mucosal bleeding. Laboratory investigations reveal thrombocytopenia, prolonged prothrombin time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT), decreased fibrinogen levels, and schistocytes on peripheral blood smear. Which of the following factors is most likely contributing to the pathogenesis of his condition?

A 68-year-old male presents to his primary care physician with complaints of increasing fatigue, unintentional weight loss, and easy bruising over the past few months. Physical examination reveals palpable lymphadenopathy in the cervical and axillary regions. Laboratory investigations show an elevated white blood cell count with a predominance of small lymphocytes. Flow cytometry analysis reveals co-expression of CD5 and CD23 with dim expression of surface immunoglobulin. Which of the following additional findings is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 60-year-old lady presents to her physician with complaints of persistent fatigue and easy bruising. She has a history of undergone multiple rounds of chemotherapy. Further genetic testing reveals a mutation in some gene having reverse transcriptase activity. Which of the following enzyme is the most likely mechanism underlying her symptoms?

A patient presented with complaint of a jaw swelling. His tissue was found to have the presence of t (8;14). The histopathological appearance of the bone marrow aspirate tissue is given in the image. Which of the following is a likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 10-year-old boy presented with complaints of recurrent bleeding. He has a retroperitoneal hematoma and develops joint pain with swelling on slight exercise. There is no mucosal bleeding in the patient. Which of the following coagulation factor can be responsible for the patient?

A 50 year old patient has malaise for 2 weeks. His investigation s revealed an elevated creatinine of 4.5mg/dl. His blood tests also showed the presence of HBs antigen. A renal biopsy was performed which demonstrated spike and dome on special staining. Which of the following conditions is the patient likely to be suffering from?

A 56 year old chronic smoker presented with complaints of weight loss and cough for more than 1 year. He also has hypercalcemia. His biopsy report revealed hyperchromatic atypical cells. Which of the following is the most likely cancer is this patient?

A 4-year-old patient presented with a rectal mass 2.5 cm by 3 cm. On biopsy it had the presence of colonic mucosa with multiple dilated glands filled with mucin and inflammatory cells. Which of the following is a likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old female presents to her primary care physician with complaints of palpitations, weight loss, and heat intolerance. On physical examination, she has a diffuse, non-tender goiter and lid lag on upward gaze. Her image is given alongside. Which of the following antibodies is most likely to be elevated in this patient?
Which of the following suggest a programmed cell death not involving caspases? Apoptosis Necrosis Pyroptosis Necroptosis Ferroptosis
Match the following stains with their respective tissue:
A physician wanted to perform plasma glucose estimation using the vacutainer shown in the image. Which of the following is the anti-coagulant used for this test?
A 50-year-old woman presents with a family history of breast and ovarian cancer. Genetic testing reveals a mutation in the BRCA1 gene. Which of the following best describes the function of BRCA1?

options.label: A
options.text: Encodes a cell surface receptor for growth factors

questions.text: A 32-year-old female presents with fatigue and pallor. She was diagnosed with TB few months back and has been taking her medications regularly. On examination, her peripheral blood smear shows ringed sideroblasts. Which of the following are likely to be seen in her blood investigations? Reduced serum iron level Reduced transferrin saturation Reduced total iron binding capacity Increased ferritin level
Which of the following is observed in a patient with hairy cell leukemia?
Match the mode of inheritance with the disorder in the appropriate column:

A 7-year-old child presents with morning headache, nausea, and vomiting. On examination, there is truncal ataxia and signs of increased intracranial pressure. MRI reveals a midline mass in the cerebellum with heterogeneous enhancement. A biopsy is performed, and histological examination shows small, round, blue cells with Homer-Wright rosettes. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not true about autophagy?

options.label: B
options.text: Targeting of organelles with enhanced activity

options.label: C
options.text: LC 3 is a marker for enhanced autophagy

options.label: D
options.text: Formation of a double membrane structure with lysosome

questions.correct_answer: B. Targeting of organelles with enhanced activity
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Targeting of organelles with enhanced activity

questions.text: Which of the following is an incorrectly matched pair?
questions.correct_answer: C. Multiple myeloma: kappa light chain
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Multiple myeloma: kappa light chain

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct about TRALI?

options.label: A
options.text: Seen most frequently with fresh frozen plasma

options.label: B
options.text: Pathogenesis is explained by double hit hypothesis

options.label: C
options.text: Anti HLA antibodies of recipient against donor antigens is causative in nature

options.label: D
options.text: Occurs usually within 6 hours of starting transfusion

questions.correct_answer: C. Anti HLA antibodies of recipient against donor antigens is causative in nature
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Anti HLA antibodies against donor antigens is causative in nature

questions.text: Which of the following is the phenomenon of a differential effect of the same gene from different parents?

An elderly smoker had several episodes of hemoptysis in the past two weeks along with fatigue, headache, nausea, and anorexia. A chest radiograph shows an ill-defined hilar mass and the transbronchial lung biopsy is performed. The microscopic appearance is shown. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most likely to be present in this patient?
A child with skin rash, reduced platelet count and high risk of infections should be evaluated for:

options.label: A
options.text: B cell tyrosine kinase activity detection

questions.text: Hepatitis B is associated with increased risk of liver cancer in patients because of

options.label: A
options.text: Increased survival time in host cells

options.label: C
options.text: Enhanced release of tumor suppressor gene products

options.label: D
options.text: Intergration of viral RNA with host DNA

questions.correct_answer: B. High rate of hepatocyte proliferation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) High rate of hepatocyte proliferation

questions.text: Due to which phenomenon, B cells express IgM and IgD antibodies at the same time?

A 35-year-old male presents with severe flank pain that radiates to the groin. He describes the pain as sudden and excruciating. Laboratory tests reveal hematuria, and imaging shows a 5mm stone located at the ureteropelvic junction of the right kidney. The patient's urine pH is 7.6. Which of the following crystals may be seen in the urine of this patient?

A 60-year-old male presents with a history of metastatic lung adenocarcinoma. He has been receiving chemotherapy but recently developed resistance to the current treatment regimen. The oncologist recommends a liquid biopsy to assess for genetic mutations and guide further therapy. Which of the following techniques is most commonly used in liquid biopsy for the detection of circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA)?

A Punjabi patient complaint of tiredness and was investigated. He has microcytic hypochromic red cells on peripheral smear. His RDW was increased and RBC count was low. Which of the following is the further investigation to confirm the diagnosis of this patient?
The clotting factors present in high concentration in cryoprecipitate are: Von willebrand factor Factor XIII Fibrinogen Thrombin
In a known case of breast cancer, Fluorescent In-Situ Hybridization (FISH) for gene amplification will be done based on which of the following immuno chemistry (IHC) staining for HER 2/Neu?
Which of the following is incorrect about invasive lobular carcinoma of the breast?

options.label: A
options.text: It tends to be multifocal and bilateral

options.label: B
options.text: It is associated with familial gastric cancer

options.label: C
options.text: There is over-activity of CDH1 gene

options.label: D
options.text: Histology shows a signet ring appearance due to intracytoplasmic mucin vacuoles.

questions.correct_answer: C. There is over-activity of CDH1 gene
questions.explanation: Ans. C) There is over-activity of CDH1 gene

questions.text: A patient has presented to the hospital with features of cutaneous vasculitis, synovitis, increased blood pressure and RBC casts in the urine. He has a history of hepatitis C infection few weeks ago. Which of the following is the likely lesion seen in his renal biopsy?

Which of the following statements is true about proto-oncogenes? KIT has decreased expression in GIST. KRAS mutation is more commonly associated with non small-cell lung carcinoma. ERBB2 over-expression is associated with breast carcinomas. PDGFR-β has suppressed expression in colorectal cancers.

Identify true statements about familial adenomatous polyposis? Autosomal recessive inheritance with late presentation If not treated, all cases progress to adenocarcinoma colon. KRAS mutations cause familial adenomatous polyposis It is associated with congenital hypertrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium.

A 30-year-old female presents with excessive bleeding following a minor injury. She has no personal or family history of bleeding disorders. Laboratory testing reveals a prolonged activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) that does not correct after mixing her plasma with normal plasma. What is the most likely cause of her symptoms?
Which of the following is correctly matched about liver tumor?

Which of the following statements is true regarding chromophobe carcinoma of the kidney? 1. It is the associated with trisomy 7 2. Arises from distal convoluted tubule 3. Can be as associated with Birt Hogg Dube syndrome 4. May resemble oncocytoma on histology 5. Affected patients have good prognosis

A 40-year-old female presents with a rapidly growing abdominal mass. Biopsy of the mass reveals a high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma. Metabolic profiling of the tumor tissue shows elevated levels of lactate and decreased mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation. Immunohistochemical staining demonstrates overexpression of hexokinase II and hypoxia-inducible factor 1-alpha (HIF-1α). Which of the following processes is most likely driving the metabolic phenotype observed in this tumor?

options.label: A
options.text: Upregulation of the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle

options.label: C
options.text: Activation of the pentose phosphate pathway

questions.text: A 56-year-old man presents with dragging pain in the abdomen. On examination, there is massive splenomegaly. Peripheral smear shows leukocytosis with increased myelocytes, metamyelocytes and basophils. Which of the following translocation is seen in this condition?

A 60-year-old male presents to his physician with concerns about aging-related health issues. He has a family history of cardiovascular disease and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Further investigation reveals dyslipidemia and impaired glucose tolerance. Research studies suggest a potential role of sirtuins in promoting longevity and improving metabolic health. Which of the following actions is most likely mediated by sirtuins?

options.label: A
options.text: Stimulation of insulin secretion from pancreatic beta cells

questions.text: Identify the incorrectly matched option amongst the following:

A 42-year-old woman presents with a painless breast lump. Clinical examination reveals a palpable, firm, non-tender mass which on mammogram shows an irregular mass with spiculated margins and microcalcifications. A diagnosis of breast cancer is made. Which of the following is correct about the disease? Most common location is the upper outer quadrant of her left breast. Usually arises from terminal duct lobular unit. Nulliparity is protective Molecular classification of breast cancer is based on gene expression profiling.
Match the following tumors with features correctly:
A baby is diagnosed with B cell leukemia. All of the following are good prognostic factors except? A. Hyperdiploidy B. Age < 1 year C. t(9;22) D. t(4;11)

A 15-year-old girl presents with a midline neck swelling that moves on deglutition. USG revealed a 2 cm x 2 cm nodule on the left lobe of the thyroid, extending into the strap muscles. The histopathology image is given below. What of the following is not correct about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased risk with RET/ PTC rearrangements and BRAF mutations

options.label: B
options.text: History of childhood radiation exposure with palpable lymph nodes as presentation

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of sheets of polygonal cells which stain positively with Congo red

options.label: D
options.text: Tumor cells have dispersed nuclear chromatin imparting it ground glass or optically clear appearance

questions.correct_answer: C. Presence of sheets of polygonal cells which stain positively with Congo red

questions.text: Match the following cell types and the malignancy they are associated with:

A middle aged lady had a severe headache with nausea and vomiting for the past 2 days. Her blood pressure was found to be 210/160 mm Hg. Her serum creatinine was 3.8 mg/dL. A renal biopsy showed the lesion affecting her blood vessels as seen in the image. Which of the following underlying diseases is she most likely to have?
Within minutes following an insect bite, a patient developed laryngeal edema. Which of the following chemical mediators is most likely responsible for this finding?

A 75-year-old man collapses suddenly after moving to the restroom from his hospital bed. At autopsy he has the gross pathologic finding shown here. Which of the following conditions is the most likely risk factor for development of this man's immediate cause of death?
Which of the following is properly matched?

options.label: A
options.text: HLA DQ2/DQ8: joint disease in which drug treatment increases risk of tuberculosis

options.label: B
options.text: HLA B27: female advised to avoid maida, sooji/semolina in the diet

options.label: C
options.text: HLA DR 4: 25 year old male with bamboo spine

options.label: D
options.text: HLA DR3: young female with butterfly rash

questions.correct_answer: D. HLA DR3: young female with butterfly rash
questions.explanation: Ans. D) HLA DR3: young female with butterfly rash

questions.text: A 55-year-old man presents to his primary care physician with complaints of fatigue, night sweats, and unintentional weight loss over the past three months. Physical examination reveals splenomegaly. Laboratory studies show a white blood cell count of 150,000/μL with a differential showing a left shift, including many myelocytes, metamyelocytes, and basophils. A bone marrow biopsy demonstrates hypercellularity with granulocytic proliferation. Which of the following is not true about his condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Exhibits the phenomenon of oncogene addiction

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of a reciprocal translocation detected by FISH

options.label: D
options.text: Clinically may progress to acute leukemia

questions.correct_answer: B. Presence of increased LAP score
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Presence of increased LAP score

questions.text: A patient diet of myocardial infarction and his heart was taken out and immersed in a solution. The normal area of the heart turned brick red whereas infarcted part turned white. Which of the following is correct about the stain and the reactive enzyme?
questions.correct_answer: B. Triphenyl tetrazolum chloride and LDH1
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Triphenyl tetrazolum chloride and LDH1

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents to the clinic with dysuria, increased urinary frequency, and lower abdominal pain for the past two days. She has no significant medical history and is sexually active. A urinalysis reveals positive leukocyte esterase and nitrites without WBC casts. Which of the following is true about her condition?
questions.correct_answer: C. Cystitis caused by Escherichia coli
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Cystitis caused by Escherichia coli

questions.text: A 60-year-old man presents to the emergency department with a 5-day history of fever, productive cough with yellow sputum, pleuritic chest pain, and shortness of breath. On physical examination, he has a temperature of 101.3°F, and auscultation of the lungs reveals crackles and decreased breath sounds in the right lower lobe. A chest X-ray shows a lobar consolidation in the right lower lobe. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause of his symptoms?
All of the following are features of Kawasaki disease except
Bilateral pedal edema is least likely to be associated with which of the following?
A male patient suffers a trauma and is being brought to the emergency of a hospital. Since he needs an emergency lifesaving transfusion, which of the following can be safely transfused in him?

A patient presents with neck swelling, weight loss and difficulty in swallowing food. Histopathological examination of the swelling shows image as provided. Which of the following is the cell of origin of this mass?
Which of the following is not correct about a patient with peripheral smear as given alongside?

options.label: B
options.text: Males and females can be affected

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced oxidative stress inside the red cells

questions.correct_answer: D. Reduced oxidative stress inside the red cells

questions.text: A 75-year-old male presents with symptoms of fatigue, weight loss, and recurrent fevers. Echocardiography demonstrates multiple small, sterile mobile masses attached along line of closure of the mitral and tricuspid valves. Which of the following underlying mechanisms is most likely responsible for the development of this cardiac manifestation?

With respect to thromboelastography, which of the following are true statements: 1. R time is dependent on the clotting factors 2. Platelet activity determines the maximum amplitude in the graph 3. LY30 represents the 30% lysis of the clot and depends on fibrinolytic activity 4. Alpha angle depends on the rate of fibrin deposition
A girl presents with short stature, webbed neck, thick calves, shield -shaped chest, swelling of the ankle, and increased carrying angle. What is the likely diagnosis?
A known patient of Burkitt lymphoma undergoes chemotherapy following which he develops tumor lysis syndrome. All of the following may be seen with tumor lysis syndrome except
Match the following microscopic finding with the type of tumor:
